globalMetadata.title: Good Thinking - NHS approved wellbeing service
globalMetadata.description: Anxious, stressed, depressed or having trouble sleeping? Find NHS-approved mental health tools and advice to support you.

links.text: Find the right help for you

footer.description: Good Thinking provides a range of resources to help Londoners improve their mental wellbeing.

subscribeFooterText.copy: Get the latest tips and resources for Londoners delivered to your inbox every month.

partners.name: Transformation Partners in Health and Care

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Find support, advice and resources by:

  • Mental health concern

Sleep, Anxiety, Low mood, Stress.

  • Audience

Young people, Employers and employees, Someone who is grieving, Faith and belief communities.

  • Type of support

Self-assessments, free apps, podcasts, videos, how to guides, workbooks.

Get expert advice from Good Thinking

The Good Thinking team has created a broad range of advice in collaboration with clinical and subject-area experts, designed to support Londoners with everyday mental health challenges.

In our Latest Advice section, you'll find short guides with tips and resource recommendations to help you with a range of concerns including dealing with uncertainty, money worries, getting enough sleep and coping with bereavement. 

If you’re looking for advice on a specific subject, type in your topic in the ‘search﻿’ box at the top of the page.

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Use the Good Thinking self-assessment tool

Our in-depth, clinically validated self-assessments are a thorough assessment of both your mental and physical wellbeing. They may seem quite ‘medical’ because they are based on the types of questions a doctor or a psychologist might ask you.

  • Each self-assessment takes around 20 minutes to complete
  • Answer questions about yourself or someone you may be concerned about
  • You’ll get a personalised list of recommended actions to take forward

howToUseSection.tabText: Find the right help for you
howToUseSection.bodyText:
Find the right help for you

Tell us what you're looking for help with and who you're looking for help for and you’ll then receive personalised recommendations for apps and other resources to meet your needs.

pageData.title: The Speakers Collective Mini-Series
pageData.subtitle: Good Thinking worked with The Speakers Collective to produce a mini-series that explores how COVID-19 has affected people with lived experience of mental health.

metadata.description: A mini-series that explores how COVID-19 has affected people with lived experience of mental health.
metadata.title: The Speakers Collective Mini-Series

contentSections.content:
Living through the COVID-19 pandemic has been challenging for us all. Whether you spent more time at home, went to work as an essential worker or home schooled your children, COVID-19 led to a huge change in the way we were able to lead our lives. After so many months of restrictions, you might have been struggling with boredom or loneliness or be stressed about your job and finances. It’s important to remember that you’re not alone.

Good Thinking worked with The Speakers Collective to produce a mini-series that explores how COVID-19 has affected people with lived experience of mental health. The videos share a range of lived experience and provide advice and suggestions that might help you or people you know. Please feel free to share the video links.

Ben Jones, trainee psychotherapist and member of The Speakers Collective, talks about how he has been looking after his mental health throughout lockdown.

Useful resources:

  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)
  • Help to cut back alcohol use (overview & link)
  • tomo (app)

Danny Rahim, actor, mental health ambassador and member of The Speakers Collective, discusses how he has been going on walks to take time away from the screen, as well as connecting with friends and family.

Useful resources:

  • Screen time: Getting the balance right (article)
  • Supporting a healthy screen/life balance during the pandemic (podcast)
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)

We hear how Dave Chawner, stand-up comic, author, presenter and member of The Speakers Collective, has been looking after his mental health during lockdown.

Useful resources:

  • Q&A: Eating disorders (article)
  • Advice for young people on how to manage eating disorders
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)

Denise Stephenson, founder of Reach Out 2 Kids and member of The Speakers Collective, talks about how her faith has been a source of comfort and support during lockdown.

Useful resources:

  • Why a micropause can help your mental health today (podcast)
  • Meditainment (app)
  • Be Mindful (app)
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)
  • How to cope with loneliness (article)

Ella Dove, journalist, author, trustee of the Limbless Association and member of The Speakers Collective, shares her story of living with PTSD and how she practices self-care.

Useful resources:

  • Why a micropause can help your mental health today (podcast)
  • Dealing with stress and trauma (podcast)
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)

We hear from Emi Howe, member of The Speakers Collective, about her experience of grief and where she has sought comfort during lockdown.

Useful resources:

  • How to cope with bereavement and grief (article)
  • Behavioural Activation Worksheet
  • Self-Compassion Workbook
  • My Possible Self (app)

Harry Corin, member of The Speakers Collective, talks about his journey to finding mental health support.

Useful resources:

  • Dealing with low mood (apps and advice)
  • NHS Talking Therapies (information)
  • Employer toolkit

Henry Johnstone, therapist and member of The Speakers Collective, shares some ideas for how you can practice self-care.

Useful resources:

  • How to connect with nature to boost your wellbeing (article)
  • How to manage boredom (article)

John Allison, founder of Motion to Mind and member of The Speakers Collective, talks about energy and the things we can do to generate more of it.

Useful resources:

  • How to connect with nature to boost your wellbeing (article)
  • tomo (app)
  • Behavioural Activation Worksheet
  • How to overcome your fears about the easing of lockdown (article)
  • How to get back into a routine after lockdown (article)

Mental health campaigner, film producer, public speaker, writer, vlogger and member of The Speakers Collective, Jonny Benjamin MBE, talks about his experience of lockdown and how he’s been making time to get away from screens and practice self-care.

Useful resources:

  • Supporting a healthy screen/life balance during the pandemic (podcast)
  • The future of work (podcast)
  • Self-Compassion Workbook

Jonny Jacobs, Finance Director at Starbucks, trustee of The Mental Health Foundation and member of The Speakers Collective, shares his thoughts on workplace wellbeing.

Useful resources:

  • Employer Toolkit
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)

Lauren Silver is an award-winning actor and jolly-anxious clown. She is also a member of The Speakers Collective. Here, she provides some tips to help you focus when you feel anxious.

Useful resources:

  • Managing your Worries Workbook
  • Depression Workbook
  • The coronavirus for those with OCD can be particularly challenging (podcast)

Lauren Silver is an award-winning actor and jolly-anxious clown. She is also a member of The Speakers Collective. Here, she provides some tips on using routine to improve your wellbeing.

Useful resources:

  • Reducing anxiety (apps and advice)
  • Self-Compassion Workbook
  • How to develop a healthy new habit (article)

Lauren Silver is an award-winning actor and jolly-anxious clown. She is also a member of The Speakers Collective. Here, she provides some tips on coping with stress and anxiety.

Useful resources:

  • Self-Compassion Workbook
  • How to cope with loneliness (article)
  • How to deal with stress (article)

Rachel Kelly, writer, public speaker, mental health campaigner and member of The Speakers Collective, shares her experience of lockdown and talks about how she has been managing her anxiety and depression.

Useful resources:

  • Mindfulness Workbook
  • How to deal with stress (article)
  • tomo (app)
  • Self-Compassion Workbook

We hear from Rupert Eyles, member of The Speakers Collective, who explains how he has used mindfulness to create a self-care routine to help manage his anxiety.

Useful resources:

  • Reducing anxiety (apps and advice)
  • Meditainment (app)
  • Be Mindful (app)
  • Self-Compassion Workbook

Steve Loft, mental health campaigner and member of The Speakers Collective, shares how his anxiety led to him taking a significant period of time off work and how important finding the right support and information was to getting the help he needed.

Useful resources:

  • Reducing anxiety (apps and advice)
  • Health Anxiety Workbook

Juliette Burton, comedian, writer and member of The Speakers Collective, shares her mental health journey and explains how her support network has helped, particularly during lockdown.

Useful resources:

  • Building healthy habits (podcast)
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)

Finlay Games, Youtuber, speaker, author, coach and mentor of The Speakers Collective, describes how he builds flexibility and self-care into his routine to look after his mental health.

Useful resources:

  • Be Mindful (app)
  • Five ways to good mental wellbeing (article)

We hear how Sanisha Wynter, Time to Change champion, Diversity and Inclusion Consultant and member of The Speakers Collective, has been coping through lockdown.

Useful resources:

  • Dealing with low mood (apps and advice)
  • tomo (app)
  • Self-Compassion Workbook
